title: Sports-no-CBC
text:
Spain's Rafael Nadal won the U.S. Open after defeating Daniil Medvedev of Russia 7-5, 6-3, 5-7, 4-6, 6-4 on Sunday.

Nadal, 33, now has 19 major championships, putting him just one behind Roger Federer's 20 and three ahead of Novak Djokovic's 16.

The so-called "Big Three" have dominated the majors for three straight years, combining to claim the past 12 Grand Slam titles.

Medvedev was playing in his first Grand Slam final. The 23-year-old is the first Russian to reach the men's U.S. Open final since Marat Safin won the tournament in 2000.

More to come.
description: Spain’s Rafael Nadal won the U.S. Open after defeating Daniil Medvedev of Russia 7-5, 6-3, 5-7, 4-6, 6-4 on Sunday.
